decks.notes: This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using powerful spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to utilize a variety of creatures with different abilities and strengths to overwhelm the opponent and control the board. The deck also incorporates Leyline cards to enhance its creatures and spells, as well as provide additional protection. By combining efficient creatures with versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, the deck aims to establish early dominance and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures to create strategic combos and out-value the opponent. It utilizes tools like Chord of Calling and Urza's Saga to tutor for key creatures like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Springheart Nantuko. The mix of creatures with different abilities allows for flexible and unexpected plays, while cards like Shuko provide additional utility. The deck aims to control the board and win through a combination of creature synergies and powerful toolbox options.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also generating value from powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Psychic Frog. By utilizing cards like The One Ring and Archmage's Charm, the deck can outvalue opponents in the late game. With a mix of disruption, card draw, and removal, the Dimir Control deck seeks to dominate the game through careful planning and powerful synergies.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The main strategy revolves around leveraging The One Ring to gain incremental advantage and outvalue opponents. Cards like Subtlety and Tune the Narrative help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional control and card advantage. The deck aims to stall the game, establish board presence with powerful threats, and ultimately dominate the game through resource management and powerful plays.

The primary focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing low-cost creatures and efficient burn spells, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck, allowing for more explosive turns and a stronger overall game plan. This Boros Aggro deck is all about applying pressure early and often to secure a swift victory.

The deck revolves around quickly and efficiently reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. It also utilizes a combination of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Prismatic Ending to control the game and protect its combo pieces. The main win condition is to bring out big threats like Griselbrand or Ulamog, the Defiler to overwhelm the opponent. The deck aims to consistently pull off its instant reanimation combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The primary strategy of the deck focuses on utilizing instant reanimation spells such as Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring powerful creatures back from the graveyard, such as Griselbrand and Ulamog, the Defiler. These creatures and supporting cards like Fallaji Archaeologist and Psychic Frog work together to create a powerful combo that can overwhelm opponents quickly. Additional cards like Solitude and Thoughtseize help control the board while Tainted Indulgence provides card advantage. This deck aims to win the game through a fast and efficient reanimation strategy while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using creatures with different abilities to assemble a powerful and adaptable combination that can be used to win the game. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Urza's Saga to tutor for specific creatures, the deck can quickly set up a board state that can overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes interaction and protection pieces like Malevolent Rumble and Sylvan Safekeeper to ensure its combo pieces can stick around long enough to secure victory. Additionally, the deck includes lands that provide flexibility and utility to support its game plan.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly and efficiently. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Amped Raptor, while supporting them with spells like Lightning Bolt and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds versatility and consistency to the deck. By utilizing powerful creatures and burn spells, this deck seeks to apply pressure early and maintain control of the battlefield to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on tutoring and playing creatures strategically, using cards like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact to search for key pieces like Delighted Halfling and Springheart Nantuko. It also utilizes tools like Shuko and creatures like Sylvan Safekeeper to protect key combo pieces. The inclusion of cards like Urza's Saga and Teferi, Time Raveler help to control the board and provide additional utility. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the variety of colors needed for the deck's strategy.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of countering opponents' spells, removing threats with targeted removal like Fatal Push and Toxic Deluge, and utilizing card advantage through cards like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage and leveraging powerful threats to close out the game. It also includes a mix of different counterspells and disruption to adapt to various matchups in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

Utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and control elements, this deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while ramping up to play massive threats such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Defiler. The deck combines ramp cards like Talisman of Impulse and Eldrazi Temple with disruption spells like Trinisphere and Kozilek's Command to control the game until it can deploy its game-winning Eldrazi creatures. Through the Breach provides a way to cheat out Eldrazi into play early, while cards like Ancient Stirrings and Ugin's Labyrinth help to find and protect key pieces of the deck.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize powerful combo pieces such as Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to quickly reanimate creatures like Griselbrand and Fallaji Archaeologist from the graveyard. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game and protect the combo. With cards like Grief and Solitude for additional value and support, the deck aims to bring out its key creatures quickly and overwhelm opponents with a powerful instant reanimator strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through discard spells and removal while utilizing creatures with strong recursion abilities. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and generate card advantage through a combination of hand disruption and powerful threats. The deck utilizes a mix of efficient removal spells, disruptive creatures, and powerful finishers to out-value and out-resource the opponent. With a focus on attrition and resource denial, it seeks to grind out victories over the long game by overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats and disruption.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy and control the game through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful threats. The deck aims to apply pressure with creatures like Boggart Trawler and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, while using cards like Grief and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's hand. The deck also utilizes powerful control elements such as Fatal Push and Necrodominance to deal with threats efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent in order to secure victory.

This deck aims to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Mine, Power Plant) to generate a lot of mana and cast big threats like Ulamog and Ugin. It utilizes the powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny to disrupt the opponent's plans. The One Ring and Trinisphere make it harder for the opponent to play their spells effectively, while Kozilek's Command and All Is Dust provide board control. Karn, the Great Creator is used to shut down artifacts and activate powerful abilities.

The main idea of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge for direct damage, along with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Amped Raptor for quick aggression, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain it throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Static Prison and Blood Moon disrupt the opponent's game plan, while the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional mana resources. The deck focuses on fast, efficient plays to finish the game quickly.

The deck focuses on using control elements to protect key pieces, such as Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Valki, God of Lies, while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Planar Genesis. The ultimate goal is to utilize Scapeshift to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and other lands, then trigger their abilities to deal massive damage to the opponent. Leyline Binding and Teferi, Time Raveler help to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy, while cards like Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines provide additional value and protection.

This deck relies on a variety of creatures with different abilities to create powerful combos and find answers to different situations. The key strategy is to use cards like Delighted Halfling and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to search for specific creatures with Chord of Calling and Urza's Saga, while also utilizing cards like Wall of Roots and Springheart Nantuko to ramp up mana. The toolbox approach allows for flexibility and adaptability in dealing with different threats and win conditions.

The deck focuses on utilizing various creature toolbox cards to create a powerful combo strategy. By using creatures like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Springheart Nantuko, alongside tools like Shuko and Chord of Calling, the deck aims to assemble key pieces quickly and efficiently. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures helps to strengthen the deck's overall strategy and resilience. With a mix of creature tutors, ramp, and protection, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with a versatile and synergistic creature-based combo plan.

This deck focuses on using a variety of creature toolbox cards to quickly assemble a powerful combination of creatures on the battlefield. By using cards like Chord of Calling and Urza's Saga to search for specific creatures, players can create strategic combinations that can overwhelm opponents. The deck includes a mix of utility creatures like Arboreal Grazer and Springheart Nantuko, along with key combo pieces like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Delighted Halfling. Additionally, cards like Thassa's Oracle and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional win conditions and disruptive elements to control the game.

The deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures that can be searched for and played at the right time to create powerful synergies and win conditions. It uses a mix of utility creatures and combo pieces, along with tutors like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact to find the right creatures when needed. The inclusion of Urza's Saga allows for additional tutoring and mana ramp, while cards like Shuko and Teferi, Time Raveler provide further utility and protection. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents by utilizing its toolbox of creatures efficiently.

The deck focuses on using powerful Eldrazi creatures to control the game and disrupt opponents, while also utilizing artifacts and spells to ramp up mana production and board control. By quickly ramping into big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker, the deck can overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and disruptive spells. The inclusion of cards like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Return also provides additional removal options to deal with threats on the opponent's side of the battlefield. Ultimately, the goal is to establish dominance and control the game with big Eldrazi threats.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard using instant speed spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. By sacrificing cards like Grief and Solitude to cheat creatures like Griselbrand and Ulamog onto the battlefield, the deck can overwhelm opponents with strong threats. The deck also includes disruption elements like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to protect its combo pieces and control the game. Additionally, the deck includes a variety of lands to fix mana and enable flexibility in casting spells.

The main concept of this Ruby Storm deck is to quickly generate mana through spells and medallions, while also utilizing cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Baral, Chief of Compliance to draw cards and increase spell efficiency. The deck aims to cast powerful spells like Flame of Anor and Past in Flames to create a storm of spells that will deal massive damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Wish allows for versatility in accessing key cards from the sideboard, while Wrenn's Resolve helps protect the combo pieces. Overall, the deck focuses on explosive turns and quick victories with its combo potential.

This combo deck aims to generate mana quickly using cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals, casting spells like Glimpse the Unthinkable to fuel Ral, Monsoon Mage's ability to copy spells. With past in flames to recur spells from the graveyard, the deck can create huge storm counts to cast a lethal grape shot or use Wish to fetch a win condition from the sideboard. The deck's key strategy is to chain together spells and mana generation to overwhelm the opponent in a flurry of spells and burn damage.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize powerful control spells and The One Ring artifact to dominate the game. By countering and removing threats while establishing board control with cards like Solitude, Phlage, and Wrath of the Skies, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to control the tempo of the game, while cards like Tune the Narrative and Lórien Revealed provide additional utility. The mana base is built to support the deck's control strategy and ensure smooth gameplay.

The deck aims to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and The One Ring. It focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while gradually building up its own resources to eventually overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Solitude and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional protection and tempo advantage. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's strategy and ensure consistency in casting its powerful spells.

The primary focus of this deck is to establish control over the game using powerful control spells and disruption while utilizing The One Ring as a win condition. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provides a strong threat while Subtlety helps with tempo plays. Counterspell and Force of Negation are essential for stopping key spells while Galvanic Discharge offers removal. Invert Polarity, Wrath of the Skies, and Supreme Verdict provide board control. Lórien Revealed and Tune the Narrative offer card advantage. Teferi, Time Raveler disrupts opponents' plays. The mana base is designed to support the deck's control elements.

The main concept of the deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to control the board by countering opponents' spells and removing threats with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Subtlety. Card advantage is gained through Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Archmage's Charm, while also providing versatility and flexibility with cards like Tune the Narrative and Invert Polarity. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents while maintaining control of the game through various means.
